channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Blackstone to Buy Rental Firm Home Partners of America for $6B
item.description: Now, the firm (and others) want back in on the soaring housing market, where last month median home prices rose almost 24% annually to break $350k. After the 2008 crash, Wall Street firms like Blackstone scooped up foreclosed homes on the cheap.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Word Search
item.author: Mary Tobler

item.title: Wingstop Launches Chicken Thigh Brand, Thighstop
item.description: Thighstop won't just be a departure from Wingstop's namesake business. Wingstop's wholesale prices have risen from as little as 98 cents last year to over $3 now, according to the company's CEO.  Zoom out: Changing demographics have boosted dark meat's popularity in recent years.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 22
item.description: (NYT Magazine) Can it be fixed?  Read: Covid proved the CDC was broken. She's not alone: More people quit the retail industry in April (~649,000) than any other month on record.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Spielberg's Amblin Partners Agrees to Make Movies for Netflix
item.description: The company has agreed to produce two or more movies a year for the streamer, some of which could be directed by Spielberg himself. Bottom line: Striking a deal with Spielberg is a flex for Netflix; he has more Oscars under his belt than any other living filmmaker.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: WeWork Posts Best 2-Month Sales Streak Since 2019
item.description: More offices are looking for hybrid or remote-friendly setups, and WeWork is once again poised to scratch the labor market's newest itch. WeWork is tracking for $1.9 billion in revenue and aims to go public this year exactly how you'd expect: a $9 billion SPAC deal with BowX Acquisition Corp.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Supreme Court Ruling Over Athlete Compensation Deals Blow to NCAA
item.description: College athletes scored another big W in their looooong quest to get paid for their work on the field. For its part, the NCAA claims that compensating student athletes would undermine the “amateur” flavor of college sports, damaging fans' enjoyment of the product. At least seven states have passed bills allowing college athletes to make money from their names, images, and likenesses that go into effect next week. Yesterday, the US Supreme Court ruled unanimously that the NCAA cannot stop colleges from compensating student athletes, as long as that compensation is tied to education.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Wingstop Launches Chicken Thigh Brand, Thighstop
item.description: Thighstop won't just be a departure from Wingstop's namesake business. Wingstop's wholesale prices have risen from as little as 98 cents last year to over $3 now, according to the company's CEO.  Zoom out: Changing demographics have boosted dark meat's popularity in recent years.

item.title: Supreme Court Ruling Over Athlete Compensation Deals Blow to NCAA
item.description: College athletes scored another big W in their looooong quest to get paid for their work on the field. For its part, the NCAA claims that compensating student athletes would undermine the “amateur” flavor of college sports, damaging fans' enjoyment of the product. If more justices adopt Kavanaugh's aggressive stance, “It could only be a matter of time before all of the NCAA's restrictions on compensation are struck down as antitrust violations,” Tulane sports law administrator Gabe Feldman told the NYT.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: Also on Tuesday, Facebook will roll out its podcast product. That report is coming on Friday. F9 will try to supercharge the summer box office when it arrives in theaters on Friday.

item.title: China Ramps up Crackdown on Bitcoin Mining
item.description: Why it matters: The restrictions mean bitcoin mining could shift out of China, which handled 75% of the world’s mining capacity before the increased scrutiny, and arrive in...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Amazon Prime Day Returns to the Summer
item.description: Today and tomorrow, Amazon will offer more than 2 million deals to its Prime members to juice e-commerce sales during what is typically a lull in the shopping calendar. this Prime Day is Jeff Bezos’s last as CEO.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: First Trial Cruise Sets off From Miami
item.description: The first nonexperimental oceangoing cruise ship to sail from US waters since the pandemic began, the Celebrity Edge, will depart this Saturday from Port Everglades with the CDC’s blessing. Last night, the Royal Caribbean’s Freedom of the Seas departed Miami, the first time a cruise ship has sailed from a US port in 15 months. And earlier this month, two passengers on a fully vaccinated cruise in the Caribbean tested positive.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Week Ahead: June 21
item.description: Facebook will roll out its podcast product on Tuesday. That report is coming on Friday.  Everything elseF9 will try to supercharge the summer box office when it arrives in theaters on Friday.

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 19
item.description: (The Ezra Klein Show) Listen: Economist Betsey Stevenson discusses the “take this job and shove it” economy.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Money Matters: Retirement Saving Comes in Two Flavors
item.description: To answer your question, those sweet, sweet tax benefits of 401(k) and IRA retirement plans come in two flavors: traditional and Roth. If you’re unsure of your retirement plans (fair) use this rule of thumb: Prioritize Roth if you’re early in your career, and traditional options if you’re mid- to late-career. The company is offering a 401(k) plan, but I also have a separate Roth IRA. Which one should I prioritize maxing out first?
item.author: Ryan Lasker

item.title: Delays From Yantian Port Shutdown Worse than Suez Canal Fiasco
item.description: The backstory: The worst of the shipping bottleneck is at Yantian, the largest port in China and the one that exports >90% of the entire world’s electronics.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Canada Extends Border Restrictions With the US
item.description: Yesterday, Canada extended restrictions on nonessential travel across the US border until July 22. Big picture: Canadian and American businesses that rely on cross-border traffic are getting FOMO as other countries open up to international travelers. to keep the virus at bay, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said the border would stay mostly closed until 75% of the population has received the first dose and 20% have been fully vaccinated.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Western US Is Suffering From a Severe Drought
item.description: The also-bad-and-ugly: power. With a record-breaking heat wave sizzling its way across the West this week, officials will almost certainly declare the first-ever water shortage for the Colorado River, which feeds Lake Mead.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Icebreakers with...Drag queen Kim Chi
item.description: After finishing in the top three on season eight of RuPaul's Drag Race, Kim Chi launched her cosmetic company, KimChi Chic Beauty, with entrepreneur and NYX founder Toni Ko in 2019. ! Who creates some of your favorite content online? What question do you wish people would ask you? I think people really vibe with that! This interview has been lightly edited and condensed for clarity. Would you like some?"  "Have you had your iced coffee today?  A sugar baby.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: What to Know About NYC's Upcoming Mayoral Election
item.description: Last October, more than 150 business leaders sent a letter to Mayor Bill de Blasio saying that degrading quality of life could hinder the city's economic recovery.  Ranked-choice voting means that instead of checking one name off on a ballot, NYC voters will be able to put down up to five, ranked by their preference. Although the Republican primary is also happening on Tuesday, in bright-blue NYC the Democratic winner is basically a shoo-in to win the general election in November. With 13 candidates on the ballot for the Democratic primary, it's the biggest field in the city's history.  Who is running?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Make It Work: How Do I Tell Coworkers I'm Not Vaccinated?
item.description: I have noticed that the privacy coworkers used to exercise around personal health information has relaxed over the past year. Ask Kate here. =Next time one of your coworkers asks you if you’re vaccinated, just say you’re not comfortable sharing personal health decisions or anything else about your medical background.  Something bothering you at work? Summer’s finally here, let’s have fun…responsibly.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Brew Crossword: Triple Lindy
item.author: Mary Tobler

item.title: Zuckerberg Has High Hopes for the Future of VR
item.description: Bottom line: After Facebook acquired another VR gaming company, BigBox VR, last week, tech reporter Alex Heath predicted, "Facebook is going to probably have a near monopoly in VR software before it even matters." He predicted VR would expand beyond gaming into areas like business meetings and fitness."
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.description: (New York Times) Read: Inside Victoria Secret's most extreme pivot in recent memory.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Defrauded ITT Students Will Get Their Money Back, Says Department of Education
item.description: Zoom out: This is the second round of loan discharges for students who were defrauded by for-profit schools since Biden moved into the White House.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Biden Signs Bill to Make Juneteenth an Official Holiday
item.description: Big picture: Texas was the first state to establish Juneteenth as an official holiday in 1980, and throughout the years, some groups have pushed to recognize it on a national scale. It's the first federal holiday created since Martin Luther King Jr. Day in 1983.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: ACA Survives Third Supreme Court Challenge
item.description: In March's Covid relief package, Biden approved higher federal subsidies for private health plans offered through the ACA and larger federal Medicaid payments for states that expand insurance coverage to more lower-income adults. In a 7–2 vote, justices ruled that Texas and 17 other Republican-led states don't have the legal standing to challenge the law in federal court.  What they were fighting aboutThe ACA's most controversial measure, the individual mandate, required Americans to pay a tax penalty if they didn't have health insurance.  The ACA, aka "Obamacare," is a controversial healthcare bill enacted in 2010.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Biden Signs Bill to Make Juneteenth an Official Holiday
item.description: Big picture: Texas was the first state to establish Juneteenth as an official holiday in 1980, and throughout the years, some groups have pushed to recognize the holiday on a national scale. Looking ahead...  The NYSE said it won’t close markets today for this year’s Juneteenth, but might next year.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 18
item.description: (New York Times)  Read: Inside Victoria Secret's most extreme pivot in recent memory. The ruse, which involved Wiesenthal imitating McLaren during TV interviews, lasted for years.
item.author: Neal Freyman
